Commit Message: different species for different mag. moments
added kptshift flag for non-gamma centered calc. and initialization feature without starting calculation
fix tabs
error fixed: espresso.py considered different atomic species with same magnetic moment to be the same
Fixed naming convention of elements with different magnetic moments, i.e. removed the _ in element names
numbers from pseudopotential files for magnetic species removed
Updated lots: fixed the species labeling for magnetic calculations and +U calculations so it is more general

added some extra defaults and flags for variable-cell calculations, which are currently only available in manual submission without ase. Also added hybrid functional flags, but hybrids are not currently available for US PSPs
added example script for manual quantum espresso job submission
added onlycreatepwinp option which creates only an input file for pw.x and does not create any subdirectories;  furthermore a bugfix for atoms2species; failed if no magnetic moments were set
implemented tot_magnetization
minor correction
with further corrections
uniqueness method did not work for unpolarized systems: fixed    &   fixed occupations added when sigma is put to zero
Update with hubbard U to be specified on species independently
added charge density and wave function saving option; restart option based on the two; total energy and force bug fixes for non-scf calculations; magmom bugfix in atoms2species
removed printout
fixed occupations added (triggered by sigma=0)
removed printout in uniqueness function
espresso parameters a bit more organised
default occupations smearing now conforms better with PWscf defaults
spin-polarisation for smearing=0.0 eV (molecules) has to be done while fixing the total magnetization
Fix rsh_agent setting for different mpi versions

re-added option to only create input file for pw.x without creating any subdirectories nor launching espresso;  set back default sigma to a finite value, to be more dacapo compatible;  fixed problem in determining number of valence electrons in new UPF format
A simple set function for changing calc parameters has been made
completion of input file is printed
enable very small smearing width
a temporary hack for starting_magnetisation, and added a usesymm input option
minor updates to set function and to hubbard U part
additional set parameters
let's Pythonize the writing of the input file a bit more. First step: a function that does the writing of txt strings to the PWscf input file.
more Pythonization, and defult convergence criteria now matches the PWscf ones.

a whole bunch of new features added
As discussed with Jess, pythonization will be re-done on the new functions added to the interface
- internal relaxation in QE implemented
- 'hund mode' implemented, which gets atomic occupation numbers right
- Hund's rule implemented (atomic_configs.py)
- functions to return the final structure and stress after an internal QE relaxation added
- pwlog2trajectory converts a pw log output to an ase trajectory file including total energies
- usesym was replaced by the many flavors of nosym, noinv, etc. that espresso supplies to allow specific types of symmetry breaking
- nfs automount issue for client nodes fixed
- path length problems with pw.inp when read from pw.x fixed
- forces can now be read from espresso without the need of having the ase3 mode working with the pw.x binary (i.e. the interface will work in this mode with a pristine version or version <5 of espresso, too)
- errors are now detected in the log output, parsed and raised as a meaningful exception
- num2str method added, which converts a number to a string of the format xey or x.yd0, such that fortran does not read garbage trailing digits (xeyd0 is not a valid fortran number form)
- default startingwfc reset to None, which means the more efficient starting guess of atomic wave functions is used unless specified otherwise (consistent with quantum-espresso default)
atomic_configs.py and pwlog2trajectory added to repository
Very useful: a print to stdout of the location of the PWscf input file after it is written
introduce verbose flag, set to low by default

local directory path fixed for serial runs
last energy and forces read for internal QE relaxation
get_total_energy option "force-consistent" implemented
fist attempt for QE-internal structure relaxations
Functions for using the Quantum Espresso optimization algorithms
minor changes

bugfix: initialize did not honour atoms parameters, but used prior atoms instead
fmax,press options to internal relaxations routines added
unnecessary calcuations for unchanged atoms avoided and further small fixes related to triggering of calculations
fixed problem with forces for scf method and deleted not finding forces if hubbard orbitals are not atomic
onlycreatepwinp option fixed
T=0 K calculations have no TS-corrections, so enforce self.occupations='fixed'
added num2str on some of the inputs in the set function
Updates set function - now works again + implemented automatic adjustment of starting magnetization
minor change to print of number of bands

log flushing for qe-internal relaxations
bugfix in relax_cell_and_atoms
bugfix in pwlog2trajectory
bugfix for reading the final array of forces during an espresso-internal relaxation
Hack to eliminate intermittent multi-node automounter problem.  Also eliminate files with mpi node information.
Separate site-specific configuration into separate python file

parts of espresso.py moved into constants.py, utils.py and subdirs.py
by default, a new espresso calculator will now stop previous calculators

parflags option added to espresso class
It is an extra string passed to pw.x:
e.g. '-npool 2'
Add in /tmp as an alternative to /scratch

calc_pdos function added
wave function clean-up changed to only remove wave functions but not atomic projections
added intelligent dipole correction and get_work_function

projected density of states, wave function, charge density, potential, reduced density gradient, etc. extraction methods added
multiespresso calculator class added, which takes care of parallelization over images (NEB)
print out pathnames for python, espresso, pseudopotentials

pipe buffer for neb added
setup.py added for installation process
optional installation directory for setup.py now to be specified with --prefix=
Fix race condition crash on ase-mode shutdown
Fix getsubmitorcurrentdir which was breaking interactive jobs
changed avoidio to disk_io and added options.  small code cleanup things also included
brought back output['avoidio']
no need to write tot_charge to input file if not explicitly specified in the calculator
Initial commit

vibespresso module added, is a calculator initializing the displacement calculations with the equilibrium KS potential
Jess' functions to read out ensemble energies added
cell_dofree for contrained unit cell relaxations added
update to be compatible with ase 3.7+ (i.e. the new calculator interface proposal)

ase constraints now handled in pw.inp, too
functions to save/load charge density and Fermi level and generate bandstructure plots added
variable spelling fixed in tot_charge and ensemble energy parts

option to not copy any data from scratch back from the network drive (removesave)
updated espsite examples - a new one using a named pipe instead of stdin for sending coordinates to pw.x (due to problems with mpich installations)
setup.py updated to install examples
espsite.py examples for PBS queueing systems for both mpich2 and openmpi installations added

cubecutperiodic tool added, which removes periodic image planes at the unit cell boundaries that espresso writes to cube files (the bader tool, e.g., expects periodic image plane free cube files)
setup.py now installs the python modules to installationprefix/lib/python2.minorversion/site-packages and pwlog2trajectory and cubecutperiodic to installationprefix/bin
header of BEEF-vdW xc energy contributions adjusted

Delete LICENSE

got COPYING file instead
added git version to __init__.py via Makefile. small README.md update
wiki added to README.md
README.md

Comments to all user-called methods added.
Fixed postprocessing to follow new espsite.py style.
Fixed number of magnetic quantum numbers in case of LS coupling
to be 2*j+1 (rather than 2*l+1).
fixed distinguishment of species in case of different spins, U-values etc. which seems to have been broken. created specobj class which has all properties of a species as attributes
corrected how J is specified in pw.inp
checking for damp algorithm fixed in case opt_algorithm is None
fixed error: ase-interface was waiting for forces from espresso even when force calculation is turned off
local density matrices must be stored with charge density for subsequent nscf calculations
remove .hub files alongside .wfc files

generate_dummy_data function method added, which generates a dummy data-file.xml, in case only the charge density had been saved and only charge-density-dependent data is to be extracted
save_flev_output/load_flev_output added which save/load almost everything but wave functions

potential energy wrapper for ase 3.7+ compatability let forces lack behind
important bugfix: potential energy wrapper for ase 3.7+ compatibility let forces lag behing
ase-constraints only be passed down to pw.inp, if espresso controls the relaxation
espfilter fixed

Added function that returns the toal number of BFGS steps after e.g. a
vc-relax.

Implements self.get_stress() function useful for ASE UnitCellFilter and StrainFilter constraint classes. The function gets the (3x3) stress tensor from self.get_final_stress() and returns the reduced stress tensor in Voigt notation.
Removed old get_stress().
forgot to return the stress tensor
avoid ASE's attempt to get the stress tensor when writing trajectories in cases where the stress was not calculated.
Introducing a get_total_magnetization() function.
Rename get_total_magnetization() to get_magnetization(), which now also returns the absolute magnetization.
add get_smearing_contribution(), which returns self.ST
changed parameters for electric field to match standard espresso names
return both spin-directions for not only for PDOS but also for total DOS
Get number of SCF steps
get_number_of_scf_steps now returns an array and has option 'all'
typo
Added support for "K_POINTS Gamma", which appears to reduce CPU and RAM load in gamma point calculations.

Changes in unit cell (when set from ase), types or number of atoms
should trigger creation of new pw.inp.
create clean copy of forces array at each update, verbose-flag added
Fix get_eigenvalues() for spin-pol cases.
addded option 'isolated', used for invoking an 'assume_isolated' method for charged systems
enable "nstep" to increase the number of scf steps in vc-relax beyond the default of nstep=50.

options for EXX calculations added.
Copying of forces array for each and every get_forces call made default.
save qexml together with charge density
Add keyword "fw" (fock-waves) for setting the plane-wave cutoff energy in EXX-type calculations like HSE.
bugfix for set() method (pw, dw); new option to set custom fft grids.
store calc.paw
Fixed compatability bug with latest ASE version (ase.io.traj.write asks for charges no, too ..) and changed units to pull them from ase.units

most of pw.x input parameter added (automatically)
ecutrho, e.g., would have preference over the ase/jacapo-style pw,
if both were specified
commas added

Added some more needed options to calculator: min_trust_radius and plot_num for pp.x calculations to extract different plot_num field (http://www.quantum-espresso.org/wp-content/uploads/Doc/INPUT_PP.html#idp26672)

mainly changes towards compatibility with python3.x with some minor
improvements as well
- replace all occurences of `has_key` with `key in dict.keys()`
- `print` statement to function
- remove obsolete import from `espresso` module
- correct exceptions, they now take the message as argument
- add `__version__` to modules
- `site`  is now an argument of `espresso` class initialized on class
  instantiation and not at the module level, can also be passes as an
  argument to to `__init__`
- extended the `SiteConfig` class to handle interactive use (`batchmode=False`)
- remove the `onlycreatepwinp` attributes, its role is now assumed by the
  site.batchmode, if it is `False` the `espresso` is in the input creation mode
